title: CCC Basic Quiz - Computer Fundamentals
description: Essential computer concepts, hardware, software, and basic digital literacy

questions.question: Who is known as the Father of Computer?
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage is considered the Father of Computer for his concept of the Analytical Engine.

questions.question: What is the full form of RAM?
questions.explanation: RAM stands for Random Access Memory, which is the primary memory of a computer.

questions.question: Which of the following is an input device?
questions.explanation: Keyboard is used to provide data and instructions to the computer.

questions.question: 1 Byte is equal to how many bits?
questions.explanation: 1 Byte is a group of 8 bits.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key for 'Paste'?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + V is used to paste the copied content.

questions.question: Which is the brain of the computer?
questions.explanation: CPU (Central Processing Unit) performs all processing tasks.

questions.question: What is the full form of ALU?
questions.explanation: ALU performs all arithmetic and logical operations in the CPU.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an operating system?
questions.explanation: Oracle is a database management system, not an operating system.

questions.question: What is the temporary storage area for data in the CPU called?
questions.explanation: Registers are small, fast storage areas used by the CPU during processing.

questions.question: Which shortcut is used to close a window?
questions.explanation: Alt + F4 is the standard shortcut to close the active window in Windows.

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of data in a computer?
questions.explanation: A Bit (Binary Digit) is the smallest unit of data (0 or 1).

questions.question: What is the shortcut key for 'Undo'?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + Z is the shortcut to undo the last action.

questions.question: Which type of memory is volatile?
questions.explanation: RAM is volatile memory; its contents are lost when power is turned off.

questions.question: What is the full form of WWW?
questions.explanation: WWW stands for World Wide Web.

questions.question: Which of the following is a search engine?
questions.explanation: Google is a search engine, while Chrome and Firefox are web browsers.

questions.question: What is the extension of a Notepad file?
questions.explanation: Notepad files are saved with the .txt extension.

questions.question: Which generation of computers used Microprocessors?
questions.explanation: Fourth-generation computers introduced microprocessors.

questions.question: What is the full form of HTTP?
questions.explanation: HTTP stands for Hyper Text Transfer Protocol.

questions.question: Which device is used for playing games on a computer?
questions.explanation: Joystick is a common input device for gaming.

questions.question: What is the shortcut for 'Bold' text in MS Word?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + B is used to make text bold.
